Colin =96

After working through most of the forum messages and considering=

various NEAT environments to work=85okay, play=85with, I downloaded your
S=
harpNEAT.  After a couple of days exploring your code, specifically
the OCR=
 experiment,  I want to complement you on the nice package you
have put tog=
ether.  Very professionally coded and commented.  I was
particularly impres=
sed you went to the trouble to write alternate
constructors for many of the=
 classes. This level of quality is tough
to maintain when working on a tool=
 primarily for one's own benefit or
learning.

It's been well over a year s=
ince I did anything serious with C# and
it's nice to get back in tune <wink=
> with the language.  Like you, I
think the MS team that designed the langu=
age did a very good job of
cleaning up C++ and the libraries and enjoy work=
ing in the C# environment.

Along with the SharpNEAT system, I downloaded t=
he handful of articles
on the site.  Have you written any "user documentati=
on" along the
lines of "Design Your Own Experiment" or do I dive in and lea=
rn by
your examples?

Thanks for all the work you have contributed.

Carl S=
trange
